algorithm_technique: Combinatorics: count occurrences of the character and use the combination formula.
problem_summary_simple: Count substrings that start and end with a specific character.
problem_summary_technical: Count the occurrences of the target character 'c' and apply the combination formula n*(n+1)/2.
key_insights: Any substring starting and ending with 'c' is formed by choosing two occurrences of 'c' (inclusive of the same occurrence).
If there are 'n' occurrences of 'c', the number of ways to choose two positions (start and end) is n choose 2, plus n for single-character substrings.
